title: 2 bedroom serviced apartment for rent
description: The Eccleston in the prestigious Belgravia offers this bright and refined two-bedroom apartment designed for both short stays and longer visits. With a spacious lounge, comfortable bedrooms and a fully equipped kitchen, it offers an easy sense of home. Moments from Victoria Station, it's a convenient and elegant base for exploring London or settling in for a week or more. <PARA> The Space <PARA> Two Serene Bedrooms with Luxury Hypnos Beds <PARA> - Handmade Hypnos mattresses (1 king + 1 super king) <PARA> - Dressed in hotel-quality linens for restful sleep <PARA> - Warm lighting and practical storage for weekend stays or longer visits <PARA> - Quiet, comfortable rooms ideal for switching off <PARA> Bright & Sophisticated Living Room <PARA> - Generous windows that fill the space with natural light <PARA> - Smart TV for easy streaming <PARA> - A welcoming area to unwind after exploring Belgravia <PARA> Modern Bathroom with Eco-Friendly Touches <PARA> - Sleek, well-designed private bathroom <PARA> - Refresh with Anatome eco-friendly toiletries <PARA> - Soft, hotel-quality towels <PARA> Work or Switch Off - Your Choice <PARA> - Fast Wi-Fi for remote work and video calls <PARA> - Peaceful residential setting for focused time <PARA> - Comfortable layout that adapts to work, recharge or leisure <PARA> OUR COMMITMENT TO SUSTAINABILITY <PARA> We are dedicated to reducing our environmental footprint without compromising on comfort. Our cleaning products are eco-friendly, and we work with brands that support global sanitation projects. You'll also find luxurious, sustainable Noble Isle toiletries, which are refillable to minimise waste and reduce plastic use. These eco-friendly choices not only care for the planet but also promote a healthier environment by reducing exposure to harmful toxins. Additionally, for every booking made, we plant a tree through MoreTrees, supporting global reforestation efforts. From the materials we choose to the services we offer, sustainability is at the heart of your stay. <PARA> GUEST ACCESS <PARA> The apartment features a seamless keyless entry system, making self-check-in a breeze. But if you'd prefer a more personal welcome, just let us know , we're happy to stop by and check you in. Our local team is here 24/7 to make sure your stay is seamless and enjoyable. Whether you need assistance with the apartment, local recommendations, or have special requests, we're just a call, text, or email away. <PARA> THE NEIGHBOURHOOD <PARA> Belgravia is one of London's most distinguished neighbourhoods: elegant, peaceful and unmistakably upscale. Staying at The Eccleston places you in a pocket of the city that feels both exclusive and effortlessly livable. Beautiful garden squares, white stucco townhouses and boutique-lined streets give the area its signature charm, while everything you need sits just a short walk away. <PARA> Start your morning with pastries from one of the artisanal bakeries on Elizabeth Street, explore independent shops and florists, or settle into a cosy café for a slow breakfast. In the evenings, you'll find stylish restaurants, neighbourhood wine bars and classic London pubs, all within minutes of the apartment. <PARA> Belgravia also offers unbeatable access to the city's most iconic landmarks. Buckingham Palace, Sloane Square, Chelsea, Westminster Abbey, the Royal Parks and the newly redeveloped Eccleston Yards - home to wellness studios, independent eateries and weekend markets - are all just moments away. It's a central location that feels calm, refined and distinctly residential despite being so close to everything London is known for. <PARA> Whether you're here for culture, food, shopping or simply to enjoy a more residential side of the city, Belgravia offers a uniquely balanced mix of sophistication and convenience. <PARA> GETTING AROUND <PARA> The Eccleston is exceptionally well connected, making travel in and out of London effortless. <PARA> Victoria Station is just a short walk away, offering: <PARA> - Victoria, District and Circle Underground lines <PARA> - National Rail services across the South of England <PARA> - Direct links to destinations like Brighton, Surrey, Kent and beyond <PARA> Gatwick Express departs from Victoria every few minutes, giving you a fast, direct route to Gatwick Airport in around 30 minutes. <PARA> Heathrow Airport is easy to reach via: <PARA> - The Elizabeth Line from nearby Paddington (10-15 minutes by taxi) <PARA> - The Piccadilly Line from Knightsbridge or Green Park <PARA> London City Airport is accessible via the District & Jubilee lines with a smooth interchange, ideal for business travellers. <PARA> Bus routes around the corner connect directly to Chelsea, Kensington, Westminster, Piccadilly, Oxford Circus and the West End. <PARA> Many iconic London sights can be reached on foot, including Buckingham Palace, St James's Park, Sloane Square, Westminster Abbey and the Thames.

title: 5 bedroom house for rent
description: Down a cobbled mews street, an immaculate dove-grey exterior is a precursor to the sophisticated interior palette found within the home. From its corner vantage point, Pembroke Mews follows the arc of the sun, with natural light pouring in through its numerous windows throughout the day. <PARA> There’s been thoughtful spatial reconfiguration I nside, with the open-plan reception room and kitchen occupying the entire first floor. A feeling of calm is set in motion by the quadruple-aspect light channels; sash windows are carved on three sides, with a glass roof positioned over a reading nook. The kitchen is stylish and streamlined, with integrated Miele appliances set for culinary creativity. Enjoy a morning coffee at the breakfast bar and spend evenings with loved ones around the marble-topped mahogany dining table. A column works to delineate the eating areas from the living room – a quietly elegant space with pale tones, an inviting sofa bed and a large sports television. <PARA> The considered palette of materials and tranquil atmosphere continues upstairs to the master bedroom suite. It’s a geometrically compelling room, with angular vaulted ceilings accentuating the sense of light and space. There’s vertical and horizontal flow across the sweeping blonde wooden floors, cabinets and wardrobes. Next door, a skylit ensuite bathroom is all greyscale marble and floor-to-ceiling storage. A guest bedroom suite is also located on this floor, and like the master, enjoys an inviting king-sized bed. From this room, there’s direct access to a terrace; an alfresco suntrap panelled in sleek glass. Three further bedrooms are nestled on the ground floor, each with desk space and plenty of storage. A family bathroom completes this floor, wrapped in smooth marble tiles with an oversized walk-in shower and bath. <PARA> Location <PARA> There’s an away-from-it-all feel to Pembroke Mews, yet the inviting thoroughfares of Kensington and Earl’s Court are just a stone’s throw away. It’s a five-minute walk to the manicured lawns of Holland Park, followed by a trip to the Design Museum or the Mosaic Rooms. An invigorating workout at 1Rebel on Kensington High Street. Head to coveted haunt the Troubadour for an evening of live music, followed by a cocktail at one of London’s best speakeasys, Evans & Peel Detective Agency.
